poem:
Title: Echoes of the Dawn

Cuckoo cries echo, 
A swift osprey heralds the dawn.
Precious water engulfs earth's cheek,
a silvered mirror reflecting past sins.
Men of steel take flight, shadows
on the vast canvas of war.
Media giants cast long tales,
while prime ministers bow before time's relentless wheel.
Phenomenon, borne of quill and hope,
like the quagga, extinct in all but memory.
